intro: Ophiorrhiza alboensis, commonly known as the white-flowered marsh bean, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhizophoraceae and is typically found in wetland and coastal areas. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and its ability to thrive in saline environments. Its roots often form symbiotic relationships with nitrogen-fixing bacteria. Ophiorrhiza alboensis plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting local biodiversity.
